intro: Castanopsis foxworthyi, commonly known as the foxworthii tanoak, is a species of evergreen tree native to the western United States, particularly in California. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, beeches, and chestnuts, and is characterized by its hard, durable wood. The tree produces small, cup-shaped fruits that contain one or two seeds, which are dispersed by animals. Its leaves are alternate,革质 (leathery), and have a glossy appearance, typical of many members of the genus Castanopsis.
